Posts.Content: [QUOTE=klains;81743]Wondering if anyone has the both at the same time. Husband diagnosis recent PC and Acromegaly ( pituitary gland produces to much growth hormone) ? I know this is a old post But I too have both . Diagnosed with the Acromegaly in early 2014 , operated to try and debulk in July 2014 . Diagnosed with prostate cancer early 2016 and will be having operation in June. Hope your husband is doing well .
Posts.Title: prostate cancer and acromegaly

Posts.Content: Great news, keep them coming.

Posts.Title: Zero club membership renewal

Posts.Content: I too had a similar experience as Highlander except for the beautiful girl I had a fat one that rubbed iodine all over my genitals to prevent infection so she said . Then the Dr. squirted the numbing gel and away he went , no pain , just a sensation that you have to urinate as he pulled the scope out . Was interesting as I was able to watch on the screen . Oh ya and the fat lady was in my view all the time .

Posts.Title: TRT after RP

Posts.Content: I think it depends on person to person symptoms/problems that a endo/uro/gp would consider it. In my case my endocrinologist is trying to get my hormones in check because of acromegaly that is causing havoc on my body. He is thinking the risk is worth it if my uro also agrees , but ultimately it will be up to me if I want to take the risk .

Posts.Content: VinceMH Yes things get better as time goes on , sometimes it feels like 2 steps forward and 1 step back . It is different for everyone but keep doing your kegels and walk what you can without over doing it and it will come around . For me it was about 5 months to get control back , now ED is another thing. Good Luck

Posts.Title: Just got great news!

Posts.Content: Hi Max Before my surgery they gave me a handout from the hospital saying about pain management which included the morphine pump as an option , but never saw or needed anything like that . They gave some pills that I did not like then after that it was just Tylenol if needed . Really not much pain at all .

Posts.Title: Catheter removal times?

Posts.Content: I had my prostate out on June 13th , Dr. said all went well and he spared both nerve packs . They kept me in for 3 days before releasing me and all has been slowly getting better . On June 30th went for my visit with the Dr. to get my catheter out and get my pathology results . Dr. said he felt I made the right choice as the cancer was on both lobes not just the right and was 10% of the prostate , stage 2 , gleason 7 3+4 stayed the same , lymph nodes 8 tested were all negative , negative margins and I go back Sept 30 for psa . Dr. feels there is a very good chance to beat this . While there he asked if I wanted to start the erection therapy or wait to get the incontinence under control , I said I'll wait .
